Comment:
!!! All values have maximum of 255 !!! Guard A = Halbardier; Bleu = Blue/Silver Guard B = Lancer Jaune = Yellow Soldier A = Swordsmen Orange = Orange Soldier B = Foot Knight Rouge = Red Officer B0 = normal Officer Noir = Black Officer = Special Officer Vert = Green Knight0 = Mounted Knight Vert Mechant = Green Enemies
-> The Higher the Value the less likely they flee and get help
is 1 for Halbardiers and Lancers and 0 for everything else = Higher number equals more attacks per minute; 0 makes ranged units unable to fire = Increases the Damage the Unit can Deal; Maximum seems to be at 100 = Blue bar stamina - the higher value, more often or bigger part of stamina is restored -> Needs to be Tested, 2 for Knight0, Soldier B and the Merry Man, 1 for Officers and Officer B0's and 0 for everything Else -> String representation of their Weapon or something similar I guess, 'SD' for normal units 'VP' for enemy Heroes. HL -> Halbardier; SW -> Sword; BW -> Bow; -> 3 for Guards; 5 for Swordsmen and Ranged; 7 for Officers; 10 for Knights and Enemy Heroes and 15 for Mounted Knights : 0 for Allies and 1 for Enemies : 1 for Mounted 0 for else : 1 for Heavy (Only Mounted Knights are Heavy) 0 for else : 1 for Enemy Heroes 0 for else : : 1 can Strangle, 0 can't Strangle
-> 11: Merry Man Staff Guy 12: Lancer 13: Archers(Merry Man Included) 14: Halbardier 15: Swordsmen 16: Officers 17: Foot Knights 18: Mounted Knights 19: Enemy Heroes 20: Crossbowmen Green Enemies: 21-27 (No Mounted Knights) = 2 for Merry Men Bow guys in Forrest Missions; 3 for Archers; 4 for Crossbowmen = Don't touch -> Needs to be Tested, 3 for Guards; 2 for Knight0, Soldier B and Scathlock; 1 for Soldier A, Officers, Guiy of Guisbourne, Longchamp and Sheriff; 0 for all Ranged and Both Merry Man Types 2 for Knight0, Soldier B, Guard A and Guy of Guisbourne; 1 for Soldier A, Officers, Crossbowmen and Scathlock, 0 for Guard B, Archers, Longchamp and Sheriff
